PWriterProxy.name: XMLPVDWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write ParaView data files (pvd).

PWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write ParaView data files (pvd). It is used to save all pieces of a source/filter to a file with pieces spread across the server processes.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the files.

IntVectorProperty.name: HeaderType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the binary data header word type. The default is UInt32. Set to UInt64 when storing arrays requiring 64-bit indexing.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The mode uses for writing the file's data i.e. ascii, binary, appended binary.

IntVectorProperty.name: EncodeAppendedData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When EncodeAppendedData is turned ON, the writer uses base64 encoding when writing binary data (only if appended mode is selected).

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The compression algorithm used to compress binary data (appended mode only). None offers fastest write, LZ4 offers fastest compressed write, ZLib offers balanced performance, LZMA offers smallest compressed filesize.

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressionLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: A compression performance parameter from 1 (faster/larger compressed filesize) to 9 (slower/smaller compressed filesize).

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

WriterProxy.name: XMLDataObjectWriterBase
WriterProxy.Documentation: Base for all XML-based file-series writers.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPolyDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write poly data in a xml-based vtk data file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write poly data in a xml-based vtk data file. Cannot be used for parallel writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write polydata in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write unstructured grid in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write rectilinear grid in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPImageDataWriter

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write image data in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

WriterProxy.name: XMLMultiBlockDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write a multiblock in a xml-based vtk data file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write a multiblock dataset in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing as well as serial writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

WriterProxy.name: XMLUniformGridAMRWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write a amr dataset in a xml-based vtk data file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write an AMR data-set (overlapping/non-overlapping) in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing as well as serial writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

WriterProxy.name: XMLHierarchicalBoxDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: (DEPRECATED) Write a hierarchical box dataset in a xml-based vtk data file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: (DEPRECATED) Writer to write a hierarchical box in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing as well as serial writing. This is deprecated. Use XMLUniformGridAMRWriter instead.

WriterProxy.name: DataSetWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write any type of data object in a legacy vtk data file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write any type of data object in a legacy vtk data file. Cannot be used for parallel writing.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

PSWriterProxy.name: PDataSetWriterPolyData

Documentation.short_help: Writer that writes polydata as legacy vtk files.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write vtkPolyData in a legacy vtk data file. This version is used when running in parallel. It gathers data to first node and saves one file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

PSWriterProxy.name: PDataSetWriterUnstructuredGrid

Documentation.short_help: Writer that writes unstructured grid as legacy vtk files.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write vtkUnstructuredGrid of data object in a legacy vtk data file. This version is used when running in parallel. It gathers data to first node and saves one file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

PSWriterProxy.name: PPLYWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write polygonal data in Stanford University PLY format.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write polygonal data in Stanford University PLY format. The data can be written in either binary (little or big endian) or ASCII representation. As for PointData and CellData, vtkPLYWriter cannot handle normals or vectors. It only handles RGB PointData and CellData. This version is used when running in parallel. It gathers data to first node and saves one file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each time step available from its input.

StringVectorProperty.label: File name suffix
StringVectorProperty.name: FileNameSuffix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The suffix to append to the file name when writing files at different timesteps. (File extensions such as .vtk should be excluded.) The % format specifiers are used. For example, _%d will write files as FileName_0, FileName_1, FileName_2, etc., and _%.3d will write files as FileName_000, FileName_001, FileName_002 etc.

PSWriterProxy.name: POBJWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write polygonal data in Wavefront OBJ format.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write polygonal data in Wavefront OBJ format. Written files contain the geometry including lines, triangles and polygons. Normals and texture coordinates on points are also written if they exist. This version is used when running in parallel. It gathers data to first node and saves one file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each time step available from its input.

StringVectorProperty.label: File name suffix
StringVectorProperty.name: FileNameSuffix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The suffix to append to the file name when writing files at different timesteps. (File extensions such as .vtk should be excluded.) The % format specifiers are used. For example, _%d will write files as FileName_0, FileName_1, FileName_2, etc., and _%.3d will write files as FileName_000, FileName_001, FileName_002 etc.

PSWriterProxy.name: PSTLWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write stereo lithography files.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: STLWriter writes stereo lithography (.stl) files in either ASCII or binary form. Stereo lithography files only contain triangles. If polygons with more than 3 vertices are present, only the first 3 vertices are written. Use TriangleFilter to convert polygons to triangles. This version of the reader is used when running in parallel. It gathers all the geometry to first node and saves 1 file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

PSWriterProxy.name: HoudiniWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write polygonal data in Houdini .geo format.

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write polygonal data in ASCII Houdini .geo (pre-v12.0) format.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

WriterProxy.name: MetaImageWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write a binary UNC meta image data.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write a binary UNC meta image data. This is a fairly simple yet powerful format consisting of a text header and a binary data section. MetaImage headers are expected to have extension: ".mha" or ".mhd"

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

WriterProxy.name: PNGWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write image data as a PNG file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write image data as a PNG file. It supports 1 to 4 component data of unsigned char or unsigned short. This Writer can also generate a stack of images when the FileName is in the form of /path/file_%03d.png and that the input data is a 3D image data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

WriterProxy.name: TIFFWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write image data as a TIFF file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write image data as a TIFF file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to be written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

WriterProxy.name: JPEGWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write image data as a JPEG file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write image data as a JPEG file. It supports 1 to 3 component data of unsigned char or unsigned short. This Writer can also generate a stack of images when the FileName is in the form of /path/file_%03d.jpg and that the input data is a 3D image data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

Documentation.short_help: Write image data as a JSON file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

StringVectorProperty.name: ArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the field to export. If Empty all fields will be saved.

IntVectorProperty.name: Slice
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Write only one slice if slice >= 0

PWriterProxy.name: ExodusIIWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write Exodus II files.

PWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write Exodus II files. Refere to http://endo.sandia.gov/SEACAS/ for more information about the Exodus II format.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteAllTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteAllTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each time step available from its input.

IntVectorProperty.name: IgnoreMetaDataWarning
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: In certain cases like Catalyst we know that metadata doesn't exist and we want to ignore that warning.

WriterFactory.extensions: g e ex2 ex2v2 exo gen exoII exoii

PWriterProxy.name: EnSightWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write unstructured grid data as an EnSight file.

PWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write unstructured grid data as an EnSight file. Binary files written on one system may not be readable on other systems. Be sure to specify the endian-ness of the file when reading it into EnSight.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

SourceProxy.name: XMLPVAnimationWriter
SourceProxy.Documentation: Internal writer proxy used when saving animation geometry to save all parts of the current source to the file with pieces spread across the server processes.

InputProperty.name: Representations
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Name of the file to write.

Property.name: Start
Property.Documentation: Used to begin writing of the animation

DoubleVectorProperty.name: WriteTime
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Write each time step in the animation

PSWriterProxy.name: CSVWriter

Documentation.short_help: Writer to write CSV files

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write comma or tab delimited files from a table. In parallel, it delivers the table to the root node and then saves the delimited file. For composite datasets, it saves multiple delimited files. If the file extension is tsv it uses the tab character for the delimiter. Otherwise it uses a comma.

StringVectorProperty.name: FieldDelimiter
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Used to set the delimiter character. This is hidden from the user and set automatically based on the file extension. An extension of .tsv will set the delimiter character to a tab. Otherwise a comma will be used as the delimiter.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each time step available from its input.

PSWriterProxy.name: DataSetCSVWriter

Documentation.short_help: Writer to write CSV files

PSWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write comma or tab delimited files from any dataset. Set FieldAssociation to choose whether cell data/point data needs to be saved. In parallel, it delivers the table to the root node and then saves the delimited file. For composite datasets, it saves multiple delimited files. If the file extension is tsv it uses the tab character for the delimiter. Otherwise it uses a comma.

StringVectorProperty.name: FieldDelimiter
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Used to set the delimiter character. This is hidden from the user and set automatically based on the file extension. An extension of .tsv will set the delimiter character to a tab. Otherwise a comma will be used as the delimiter.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

IntVectorProperty.name: FieldAssociation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the attribute data to pass.

IntVectorProperty.name: AddMetaData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: It is possible for this filter to add additional meta-data to the field data such as point coordinates (when point attributes are selected and input is pointset) or structured coordinates etc. To enable this addition of extra information, turn this flag on.

WriterProxy.name: HyperTreeGridWriter

Documentation.short_help: Write HyperTree data as a HyperTreeGrid file.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write hypertree data as a HyperTreeGrid file.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The input filter/source whose output dataset is to be written to the file.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The mode uses for writing the file's data i.e. ascii, binary, appended binary.

IntVectorProperty.name: EncodeAppendedData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When EncodeAppendedData is turned ON, the writer uses base64 encoding when writing binary data (only if appended mode is selected).

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The compression algorithm used to compress binary data (appended mode only). None offers fastest write, LZ4 offers fastest compressed write, ZLib offers balanced performance, LZMA offers smallest compressed filesize.

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressionLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: A compression performance parameter from 1 (faster/larger compressed filesize) to 9 (slower/smaller compressed filesize).

WriterProxy.name: XMLPPolyDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPUnstructuredGridWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPStructuredGridWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPRectilinearGridWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

WriterProxy.name: XMLPImageDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

WriterProxy.name: XMLMultiBlockDataWriter

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

WriterProxy.Documentation: Variation with catalyst specific extensions.

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteFrequency
IntVectorProperty.label: Catalyst Write Frequency
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set how often Catalyst runs will export this data product. Zero is OK and means only when output is forced by the simulation.

StringVectorProperty.name: CatalystFilePattern
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the filename pattern Catalyst runs will use to export this data product.

Documentation.short_help: Expose a writer for catalyst.
Per object setup for Cinema Image Database output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: The filter/source whose output dataset is to written as a layer in the cinema database.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A dummy placeholder to satisfy writer infrastructure.

IntVectorProperty.name: CellAttributes
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Non user facing property exists only to constrain the cell array UI.

StringVectorProperty.label: Cell Arrays
StringVectorProperty.name: Cell Arrays
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name(s) of the cell aligned array(s) to export.

IntVectorProperty.name: PointAttributes
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Non user facing property exists only to constrain the point array UI.

StringVectorProperty.label: Point Arrays
StringVectorProperty.name: Point Arrays
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name(s) of the point aligned array(s) to export.

StringVectorProperty.name: Cinema Parameters
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A set of values to explore inside the cinema database. Empty means use only the default value from pipeline. A comma separated list of values for a contour, slice or clip filter will cause the filter to iterate through the set.
